title: 110_hr2085
content: The "McGee Creek Project Pipeline and Associated Facilities Conveyance Act" defines terms such as Agreement, Authority, and Secretary. It involves the conveyance of certain facilities at the McGee Creek Project in Oklahoma to the McGee Creek Authority. The Secretary has the authority to convey various facilities at the McGee Creek Project to the Authority, including the pumping plant, raw water pipeline, surge tank, regulating tank, operation and maintenance complex, and other associated land and easements. The Secretary has the authority to convey facilities at the McGee Creek Project to the Authority, including land associated with the facilities. The mineral estate is excluded from the conveyance, and any retained mineral interests must be managed in accordance with Federal law and not interfere with the project's purposes. All parties involved must comply with the terms of the conveyance agreement and applicable laws. The Secretary can convey facilities at the McGee Creek Project to the Authority, excluding the mineral estate. Compliance with the conveyance agreement and applicable laws is required. Before conveyance, the Secretary must fulfill actions under various laws. Upon conveyance, the Authority must comply with operating the transferred facilities. After the conveyance of land and facilities, the Authority must comply with all laws and be responsible for operation, maintenance, and costs without receiving federal funding. The United States will not be liable for damages related to the conveyed land and facilities, except for negligence committed before the conveyance. This does not add to any existing liability under title 28, United States Code. The contract numbered 0-07-50-X0822 between the Authority and the United States for the McGee Creek Project remains in effect, with the possibility of amendments. The reclamation laws will still apply to project water provided to the Authority despite the conveyance of land and facilities.
